summary: This is an email chain from December 16, 2021, forwarding a communication from attorney Gerald N. Silver to the FBI. The attorney formally notifies the FBI that he represents a client in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell and instructs that all future communications must go through his office.

persons.name: Gerald N. Silver
persons.context: Attorney who sent a formal notice to the FBI stating his office represents a client in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and that all communications must be directed to his office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the email subject line: United States of America v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20-cr-330.

connections.description: Gerald N. Silver's law office states it represents a client in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, implying an attorney-client relationship with Maxwell or a co-defendant/associate.

events.title: Attorney Notice to FBI
events.description: Attorney Gerald N. Silver sends a formal notice to the FBI instructing them to cease direct contact with his client and to direct all communications concerning the Ghislaine Maxwell case to his office.

locations.address: 21201 Victory Boulevard, Suite 200, Canoga Park, CA 91303-2866
locations.context: The address of the Law Offices of Gerald N. Silver.

keyFacts: Attorney Gerald N. Silver formally notifies the FBI that his office represents a client in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The communication instructs the FBI to cease any direct contact with the client and to route all future communications through Silver's law office.
The document is an email chain dated December 16, 2021, highlighting ongoing legal procedures and attorney involvement during Maxwell's trial.
